com.btc.redg.runtime.insertvalues

Class DefaultSQLValuesFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.btc.redg.runtime.insertvalues.DefaultSQLValuesFormatter
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SQLValuesFormatter

    public class DefaultSQLValuesFormatter
extends Object
implements SQLValuesFormatter
    The default SQLValuesFormatter. Can format NULL, String/VARCHAR(2), DECIMAL/NUMBER (with Booleans as 1/0) and date types with the TO_TIMESTAMP function. Every unknown type gets inserted with its Object.toString() representation.

    • Constructor Summary

      DefaultSQLValuesFormatter()

    • Method Detail

      • formatValue

        public <T> String formatValue(T value,
                              String sqlDataType,
                              String fullTableName,
                              String tableName,
                              String columnName)
        Description copied from interface: SQLValuesFormatter
        Formats a value so that it can be inserted into the extractor. This is used to deal with some of the weird SQL types and formatting
        Specified by:
        formatValue in interface SQLValuesFormatter
        Type Parameters:
        T - The type of the value
        Parameters:
        value - The value that has to be formatted
        sqlDataType - The SQL data type
        fullTableName - The full table name, with schema
        tableName - The table name
        columnName - The column name
        Returns:
        The string that gets placed in the SQL INSERT statement
